Based on your preferences and the genre you specified, I would recommend The Imitation Game as an option.
The Imitation Game is a historical drama film based on the book The Imitation Game by Andrew Niccol. The film stars Benedict Cumberbatch, Keira Knightley, Matthew Goode, Tom Hiddleston, Tom Felton, John Lithgow, and Mark Rylance.
The plot of The Imitation Game follows the story of British mathematician Alan Turing who is appointed as the head of a top-secret intelligence agency known as Bletchley Park (BP). Turing's task at BP is to decrypt German Enigma codes which are used to transmit secret messages between Germany and other countries. Turing is faced with several challenges in his task at BP, including working under tight security protocols and dealing with confidential information that may be leaked by unauthorized individuals.
Based on the plot of The Imitation Game, it appears to be a historical drama film based on the book The Imitation Game by Andrew Niccol.

Based on the provided list of movies and their respective plot descriptions, I would recommend "Taxi Driver" as a must-watch movie.

"Taxi Driver" is a classic film directed by Martin Scorsese and released in 1976.

The plot of "Taxi Driver" follows a lonely New York City taxi driver named Travis Bickle who becomes obsessed with the idea that he can help save humanity from itself.

Travis' obsession with saving humanity is encapsulated by his iconic monologue at the end of the film:

"I'm just a simple guy. I don't want to change anything in this town. But if some people really need my help, I'd be more than happy to lend it."
